focus: Week 04: S3 Consistency (The Uphill). Trust the compression.
goal: Week 04: Sub-56s Consistent Pace. S3 σ < 0.4s.

adhd_adaptations: Emotional range coaching (supportive, frustrated, demanding, 'I told you so', matter-of-fact)
preferences: Responds well to having feelings validated by data
Responds well to proper racing coach emotional range (not just cheerleading)

coaching_moods.supportive: When progress is made, advice followed, PBs achieved
coaching_moods.matter_of_fact: Neutral sessions, first time at tracks, normal practice
coaching_moods.skeptical: When excuses appear, times don't match story
coaching_moods.frustrated: 3+ sessions without improvement, same mistake repeated
coaching_moods.confrontational: When advice is ignored completely, wasting potential
coaching_moods.i_told_you_so: When Master Lonn finally listens and it works (victory moments)

session_history.key_achievements: First Victory (P1), Flow State Discovery (50.768s race lap), Mental Reset Strategy established.
session_history.key_lessons: Speed comes from flow/calm, not forcing. 'Restart Strategy' works for filtering chaos. S3 is a core strength.

session_history.key_achievements: Race PB (1:28.508), Top 500 Global Ranking, Setup Breakthrough (57.5% BB), Position Secured Protocol.
session_history.key_lessons: Throttle overlap diagnosis (foot position). 'Meebewegen' racecraft (strategic patience). Cold Tire Contract v1 (needs v2).

session_history.notes: WEEK 03 SESSION 3 - UNDERSTANDING. 'Engine braking rotation is smoother than trail braking'. T5-T6 sequence mastery. New PB 1:26.090. Incidents halved. Trust established.

session_history.focus_area: Racecraft under pressure - Hard AI training
session_history.notes: WEEK 03 SESSION 5 - THE FREE AIR REALITY CHECK. Started P7, pressure led to 5 incidents, dropped to P12 (Last). Once alone, drove 1:26.6 pace with 0.39s sigma (hot-lapping in free air). Pace is real, but racecraft under pressure needs work.

WEEK 03 SHADOW EXPERIMENTS. R3: 'Kissed guy in front' (0x), good proximity. R4: 'Punted from back' (braked too early?), but recovered with 0.26s sigma consistency L5-9. Mental toughness proven. Vision technique: 'Looking through the car' established.

session_history.focus_area: Cold Tire Contract v2.0 - Survival & Attack
session_history.notes: WEEK 03 VICTORY. Quali P11 (1:27.1) -> Finish P1 (1:25.7 NEW PB). Cold Tire Contract executed perfecty (slow L1-3, attack L4+). Zero incidents. Alien consistency (0.16s). Proof that 'Patience is Pace'.

WEEK 03 FINAL. Quali P5 (1:26.472) -> Race P2. Best lap 1:25.756 (near PB). Gap to optimal 0.08s (Efficiency Maxed). S3 consistency is elite (0.07s). Contracts (Cold Tire/Shadow) working under pressure.
WEEK 03 FATIGUE. Felt 'sloppy' (>1s sigma), actual 0.74s. S1 (Technical) suffered (0.53s sigma), S3 (Flow) remained perfect (0.09s sigma). Incidents (6) show brain drain. Rest required.
WEEK 03 RACE 1. Top Split (SoF 1649). Quali P3 (1:26.8). Finish P3. 'Cozy' race. Elite consistency (0.36s). iR +58, SR +0.57 (0 inc). Validated 'Meebewegen' strategy.
WEEK 03 RACE 2. P1 Victory! 1601 iRating achieved. 'Boring' race (leaders crashed). S2 (0.28s sigma) still the variant sector. 3/4 sectors robot-consistent.

session_history.key_achievements: Top Split P3 (Official), AI Victory (P11->P1), Elite Consistency (0.36s), Meebewegen Strategy Validated.
session_history.key_lessons: Engine Braking > Trail Braking (T5). Pressure improves focus ('Pressure Performer'). Cold Tire Contract v2.0 works. Efficiency gap closed (0.12s).

session_history.notes: WEEK 04 SESSION 2 - LIMIT FINDING. NEW PB 56.278s (P65/1229 = top 5.3%). Deliberate chaos session to find edges. S2 (Esses) = elite σ 0.15s. S3 (Uphill) = chaos σ 1.13s. Gap to top 10 = 0.41s (exactly what T7+T5 exits cost). Clean lap during chaos session proves pace is real.

session_history.focus_area: S3 Consistency (The Uphill / T5) - Trust the compression
session_history.notes: WEEK 04 SESSION 3 - FRUSTRATION LOOP. Best lap 56.591s with only 0.11s gap to theoretical optimal (efficiency is there), but overall σ stayed high (1.19s) because S3 remained a coin flip (σ 1.07s). S1/S2/S4 were stable; the repeat f*ckups are concentrated at T5. Self-report: 'no clue how to take T5 properly' → track guide study planned; next session scheduled after studying. Symptom: occasionally hits red anti-cut blocks, 'no souplesse', spins after taking the first kerb.

session_history.focus_area: S3 Consistency (The Uphill / T5) - Throttle ramp over kerb
session_history.notes: WEEK 04 SESSION 4 - PRACTICE RUN 2. Less spinning than morning confirmed by data: overall σ dropped to 0.69s and S3 σ dropped to 0.42s (near goal <0.40s). Best lap improved to 56.480s. T5 still the main leak (~0.37s avg loss in S3), but mistakes are more survivable (more clean reps). Garage61: 01KDWHYY71TG1TMH8N972SJ2CD.

session_history.focus_area: Chapter 16 Field Test - T5 (The Uphill) entry setup (LEFT edge usage)
session_history.notes: WEEK 04 SESSION 5 - EDGE MAPPING DRILL (Chapter 16 applied same day as written). Deliberate practice session: baseline laps → slow edge-finding (70% pace, T1/T5/T7) → ramp-up (80-90%) → race pace. Overall σ (1.83s) is misleading (drill format mixed slow/fast laps). Key win: screenshots confirm now using full LEFT side on T5 entry (no more 30cm 'fear tax' buffer). S2 σ = 0.19s (excellent). S3 σ = 1.03s (high due to drill laps). Best lap only 0.22s off PB despite drill format. Next: validate if wider T5 entry calms the exit snap. Driver debrief: 'Better positioning screenshots' (4-word summary, ADHD-approved efficiency). Garage61: 01KE1M771419PBJPNSWR3709YS.

WEEK 04 SESSION 6 - BREAKTHROUGH. NEW PERSONAL BEST 56.238s (0.04s improvement over Dec 31 PB). Overall σ = 0.37s (CRUSHED target of <0.60s). S3 σ = 0.183s (56% improvement from Run 2's 0.416s, CRUSHED target of <0.40s). All sectors now within 0.09s variance of each other - no weak link remains. Gap to theoretical optimal = -0.011s (beat own best sectors due to momentum carry through transitions). 24/27 clean laps (89%). Chapter 16 (Edge Mapping Drill) VALIDATED: wider T5 entry from Practice 03 directly led to consistency breakthrough in Practice 04. Driver self-assessment: 'I can drive these times consistently for laps on end' - data confirms this claim. Race-ready. Garage61: 01KE1QHM5YMZ6EGFZWRA4DWNX9.

session_history.focus_area: Race Validation - Cold Tire Contract + Meebewegen + Exit Speed Weapon
session_history.notes: WEEK 04 SESSION 7 - RACE VICTORY. Quali P5 (57.417s) → Finish P1. Cold Tire Contract executed (L1-L3 survival, L4+ attack). Meebewegen strategy: let field sort itself, then strike. Overtakes: 'Faster exit out of the last corner, slip stream, bam' (T7 exit speed weapon deployed). No chaos inheritance - earned all 4 positions with racecraft. Race best lap 56.869s (0.631s slower than practice PB 56.238s, expected with traffic/strategy). Racing lap consistency σ ~0.43s (vs practice 0.37s) = consistency transfers to pressure. S2 (Esses) elite σ 0.096s in traffic. Brake authority: 77.7% max (vs 75.8% practice) - pressure unlocks commitment. Driver self-assessment: 'Felt confident and smooth'. Chapter 16 spatial confidence held under race conditions. Cold Tire Contract win streak: 2/2 (Winton P11→P1, Lime Rock P5→P1). Exit speed work pays off: T7 exit → slipstream pass. Victory #4 of season. Garage61: 01KE1YY1D8CYEM47FCEX2THB2K.

insights: Brake Bias Protocol (Winton): Start 57.5% (stability on cold tires). Click down (2 clicks) to 56.5% after L3+ as tires warm up and rotation is needed. 56.5% is the floor.
Vision Technique: 'Looking through the car' is the key to proximity. Focus on track, treat car ahead as peripheral obstacle. Enables flow state in traffic.
Proximity Gap: 0.2s feels risky but is safer than 0.4s+ because it prevents 'gap panic' when leader brakes. Being closer means reacting to their car body language, not just brake lights.
Cold Tire Contract v2.0: PROVEN. Giving up pace in L1-L3 (Survival Mode) allows for 'Alien Mode' in L4+ once tires/nerves settle. Resulted in P11 -> P1 drive.

Quali Reality: Race pace (1:26.2) > Quali pace (1:26.8) is normal due to tire physics. Everyone is faster in race. The goal is not to match race pace, but to maximize cold tire grip relative to field.
Engine Braking > Trail Braking (FF1600): For light rear-engine cars, engine braking provides smoother rotation and less abrupt weight transfer than brake pedal (Winton T5 discovery).
Hardware/Technique Link: Throttle overlap (resting foot) causes snap oversteer. Clean inputs must be verified before adjusting setup.
Meebewegen (Strategic Patience): Go with the flow in early laps (80-90%), let chaos settle, then attack. Works for ADHD brain to reduce load.
Short vs Tall Gear Stacks: Winton (Short) = forgiving, strong engine braking. Rudskogen (Tall) = precise, weak engine braking. Track personality dictates gear strategy.
REALITY CHECK (Alien Pace): 1:25.7 is great, but 1:24.0 (Eric Wong) is the true Alien benchmark. 1.7s gap remains. 0.7s to just break into 1:24s.
Efficiency Maxed (0.08s Gap): Gap to theoretical optimal is only 0.08s. This means the 'easy speed' is gone. Further gains require moving the limit (better line/technique), not just reducing errors.
Fatigue & Precision: Fatigue degrades Technical Sectors (S1, S2) first. Flow Sectors (S3, S4) relying on muscle memory remain robust. When tired, 'Robot Mode' works in flow, but fails in precision.
Meebewegen (Strategic Flow): In high-stress Top Split, 'going with the flow' (Meebewegen) rather than fighting for every inch yields better consistency (0.36s) and speed than aggression.

Momentum Chaining (Lime Rock): On short tracks like Lime Rock, corners chain together. A poor T1 kills T2 which kills T3. One throttle commit, one brake, flow through. The track rewards rhythm over heroics.
Compression Grip (T5 Uphill): Uphill transitions load front tires naturally. Panic-braking wastes this 'free grip'. Lift-only entry + early throttle commit = faster than heavy braking.
S3 Variance Pattern: When S3 σ is 4-7x higher than other sectors, it's a bravery/consistency problem, not technique. The fast laps prove the skill exists - now make it repeatable.

Chapter 16 (Spatial Awareness) VALIDATED: Edge Mapping Drill (Practice 03: slow edge-finding at 70% pace) → Race Pace Validation (Practice 04: normal session) resulted in 56% S3 consistency improvement (0.416s → 0.183s σ) AND new PB (56.238s). Proof: addressing spatial fear ('30cm buffer tax') directly improves both consistency and pace. Theory-to-practice cycle = 3 hours (chapter written morning, applied morning, validated afternoon).

Negative Gap to Optimal (-0.011s): When best lap beats theoretical optimal (best sectors combined), it means momentum carry through sector boundaries is working. Not just hitting checkpoints—flowing through entire lap. This is 'lap-level' optimization vs 'sector-level' optimization.

Telemetry Comparison (Gong vs Master Lonn - Lime Rock GP): 0.541s gap. Key findings: (1) T5 (uphill) is NOW FASTER (+1.87 km/h vs Gong) - Chapter 16 validated in competition context. (2) T1 is biggest loss zone (-13.94 km/h) tied to T9 exit speed. (3) Max lateral G: Gong 3.16G vs Master 2.28G (0.88G gap) = not at tire limit yet, room to push harder. (4) Brake authority: Gong uses 92.3% vs Master 75.8% - not using full brake potential. (5) Faster on 43% of lap (competitive), slower on 57% (concentrated in 3 zones: T1, T6/T7, straight).

Cornering Grip Headroom: Max lateral G comparison reveals driver is using 2.28G when car is capable of 3.16G (Gong proves it). That's 0.88G (28%) of untapped cornering potential. This is technique-limited, not car-limited. Building confidence in higher cornering loads is the next frontier after consistency is locked in.

Cold Tire Contract v2.0 Win Streak (2/2): Winton AI Race (P11→P1), Lime Rock AI Race (P5→P1). The contract works consistently: survive L1-L3 at 80-85% pace (let tires/nerves settle), then deploy race pace L4+ when field spreads. This strategy converts mid-pack starts into victories by avoiding early chaos and capitalizing on mistakes ahead. Proven across two different tracks.

Exit Speed as Overtaking Weapon (Lime Rock T7): Better exit from The Diving Turn (T7) directly translated to slipstream passes on the main straight into T1. Driver quote: 'Faster exit out of the last corner, slip stream, bam.' This validates the Week 04 exit speed focus—it's not just lap time, it's racecraft. Exit advantage → drag reduction → clean pass. The physics work.

Consistency Transfer to Pressure (Practice → Race): Practice σ 0.367s → Race σ ~0.43s. The consistency built in practice holds under race pressure (traffic, positioning, strategy). Only +0.06s degradation despite added variables. This proves the mental/technical foundation is solid. Repeatability isn't just hot-lapping—it's deployable in competition.

Brake Authority Under Pressure: Practice max brake 75.8% → Race max brake 77.7%. Pressure situations (defending, attacking, traffic) unlock higher commitment levels than solo practice. This suggests the mental limiter (fear/caution) relaxes when focused on competition vs lap time. Race conditions can reveal true capability.

Chapter 16 Race Validation: Spatial awareness confidence ('knowing where edges are') built in Practice 03 (edge mapping drill) held under race conditions. Driver self-assessment: 'Felt confident and smooth.' The work doesn't evaporate under pressure—it becomes the foundation for calm, fast racing. S2 (Esses) σ 0.096s in traffic proves precision holds even in tight sections with opponents nearby.
next_steps: Continue AI Races (Week 04 Lime Rock): Victory #1 achieved (P5→P1). Continue deploying Cold Tire Contract + Meebewegen + Exit Speed weapon. Build race data (σ consistency, incident rate, overtaking success). Goal: multiple wins before moving to next track.

Race Strategy VALIDATED: Cold Tire Contract v2.0 (2/2 wins), Meebewegen (proven), Exit Speed Weapon (T7 overtakes work). Keep using these. No changes needed. Data collection: track race σ consistency across multiple races (target: maintain ~0.43s or better).

Post-First-Race Analysis COMPLETE: ✅ Consistency transfers (0.37s practice → 0.43s race). ✅ Exit speed = overtaking tool (T7→slipstream→pass). ✅ Chapter 16 confidence holds under pressure. ✅ Cold Tire Contract works (P5→P1 clean). Continue racing to build sample size.

Gong Gap Closure (DEFERRED until Week 05+): 0.541s gap identified. Priorities logged (T1 entry, T6/T7 chain, lateral G building, brake authority). Week 04 mission: race wins > lap time hunting. Apply these improvements at next track with Chapter 16 drill early.

Next Track Prep (Week 05): Apply Chapter 16 Edge Mapping Drill day 1 of new track (proven 3-hour theory-to-breakthrough cycle). Use T7 exit speed lesson: identify which corner exits onto longest straight = overtaking weapon zone. Deploy Cold Tire Contract from Race 1.
Victory Streak Goal: 4 wins in 4 weeks so far (Jefferson, Winton x2, Lime Rock). Can we make it 5 in a row at Week 05 track? Maintain momentum.

guidebook_updates.source: Week 04 Lime Rock Park GP - driver self-diagnosis of edge usage
guidebook_updates.title: Chapter 16: Spatial Awareness & Track Limits (COMPLETED + FIELD TESTED)
guidebook_updates.field_test: 2026-01-03 Practice 03 - Applied Edge Mapping Drill same day as chapter was written. Screenshots confirm T5 entry now uses full LEFT side (no more 30cm buffer). Drill format executed correctly: baseline → slow edge-finding → ramp-up → race pace.
guidebook_updates.summary: Driver observed VRS coach using ~30 cm more track width on entry + exit vs own lines. Created full chapter codifying the 'Edge Mapping Drill' (3-phase: exit edges, entry edges, comparison). Principle: aliens aren't braver—they just have confident spatial maps of where the track edges are. Drill builds that map through deliberate, repeatable edge-touching at slow pace, then validates at race pace. Addresses 'fear tax' buffer and connects to exit speed + consistency improvements.
guidebook_updates.evidence: Driver statement: 'I seem to leave at least 30cm room compared to my VRS coach... I don't think I really know where the edge is when I'm in the car. Too cautious.' Connected to T5 exit consistency problem (not just throttle, but also not letting car run to full width). FIELD TEST: Screenshots from 2026-01-03 session confirm spatial calibration working - now kissing left edge on T5 entry.

guidebook_updates.source: Week 04 Lime Rock Park GP - T5 (The Uphill) consistency work
guidebook_updates.title: Kerb = maintenance, crest = commit (throttle ramp over kerb/crest)
guidebook_updates.summary: When the car is unsettled/unloading over a kerb/crest, full throttle while still steering is a snap-oversteer trigger. Use maintenance throttle (10–30%) over the kerb, then ramp (20→40→70→100) only as steering unwinds. Avoid red anti-cut blocks; treat them as invalid reps.
guidebook_updates.evidence: Driver report: spins after first kerb when back on throttle + occasional red block hits. Data: S3 σ improved from 1.075s (10:12 CET) to 0.416s (11:34 CET) after focusing on survivable sequencing.

guidebook_updates.source: Week 04 Lime Rock Park GP - coaching cue
guidebook_updates.title: Hands quiet → foot loud (sequencing cue for ADHD-proof execution)
guidebook_updates.summary: Simple cue to prevent throttle-oversteer: if hands aren’t calm yet, throttle is not allowed to be brave. Build power as steering unwinds; no stab/lift/stab.
guidebook_updates.evidence: Observed failure mode: snap on throttle at T5 after first kerb. Cue aligns with measurable S3 σ drop when driving became more repeatable.

guidebook_updates.source: Week 04 Lime Rock Park GP - comparison chasing (Gong 1st gear)
guidebook_updates.title: Gear choice is a multiplier, not a fix (don’t copy aliens before sequencing is stable)
guidebook_updates.summary: Downshifting to 1st at T5 can work for experts, but it amplifies rear instability if sequencing is sloppy. Rule: earn fancy gears after you can repeat the corner cleanly (no reds, no spins) in the stable gear.
guidebook_updates.evidence: Driver observed Gong using 1st at T5 while driver snaps on throttle over kerb; switching to 1st would likely increase snap risk until throttle/steer timing is controlled.
